page.title: 09BOSTON WEST INTERVIEW
page.content: {Mrs. Patterson}lives on{Rosebery {Avenue,}and is the{mother of Mrs. {Green,}a teacher in school.{Mrs. {Patterson}was born in{Chatham Kent, and came to{Boston in 1918.}At this time{milk, coal, bread, greengroceres {and meat}were delivered.{Mrs Patterson went to a{convent school}at{Swineshead where she was taught to walk properly, {sing, sit and dance.}They also did {needlework and cooking.}After school she went to{singing lessons,}at a cost of{2 shillings for half an hour.}To get to{Swineshead}you went by{car}if you were lucky otherwise you had to {cycle or walk the seven miles.}Every {Wednesday and Saturday}a{man delivered {parcels}in the{area}and you could get a{ride from the White Horse Hotel which was where{Grandways is in West {Street. Mrs.Patterson}would be taken to the market on the{"Green"at Bargate
